intro: Thlaspi oppositifolium, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, yellow flowers. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Thlaspi oppositifolium is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor conditions.
